type: MINISTIRE DES TRAVAUX PUBLIC ET DES SERVICES GOUVERNEMENTAUX (SUBPROCURING)
short_summary: Removal and disposal of the sunken ship Lynda Hindman in Lake Huron, Ontario
description: Cleaning up the shipwreck to avoid damage to the environment and marine wildlife. The winning bidder will have to carefully remove and dispose of the entire sunken cargo from the lake.
full_summary:
=================

### Request for Proposal (RFP)

#### Contract Title and Number
Partial Removal and Disposal of Sunken Steamboat “Lynda Hindman”

**Title in English:** 
For the Partial Removal and Disposal of the Sunken Steamboat “Lynda Hindman”, Lake Huron, County of Huron
**Title in French:** 
Pour l’enlèvement partiel et l’élimination de l’épave immergée du bateau à vapeur Lynda Hindman, lac Huron, comté d’Huron

#### Reference and Solicitation Number
WS4214982009 / Doc4215574665

#### Amendment and Tender Status
The tender publication has undergone one amendment. The tender proposal is considered expired as of November 17, 2023.


#### Notice Type and Procurement Method
This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) that follows a competitive and open bidding process. Selection will be based on the lowest price bidding process.


#### Service Request
Transport Canada (TC) requires services for the partial removal and disposal of the sunken steamboat “Lynda Hindman” located in Lake Huron, near Bayfield, Ontario. The removal and disposal of all parts of the vessel that are above the surface of the water and parts of the vessel under the water up to a depth of 1.5 meters from the surface are required. The work involves the safe removal and disposal of specified parts of the vessel.


#### Requirements and Schedule
The contract is expected to commence without a specific date, with a completion date of December 15, 2023. The contractor has up to 30 November 2023 to remove all parts of the vessel that are above the surface of the water and parts of the vessel under the water up to a depth of 1.5 meters from its current location.


#### Additional Requirements
An Indigenous Benefits Plan (IBP) is required with this proposal. Proposals should demonstrate how your business intends to meet IBP requirements.


#### Contact Information
For any inquiries or clarification, please refer to the notice published on Ariba Discovery: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17465067?extsite=MTc0NjUwNjdfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==]

Public Works and Government Services Canada
Kimberly Walker, (Email:kimberly.walker@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
